reviewText:
This is the 3rd in the series on Steam and the most difficult.  Despite an 85% positive rating (August 2015) there are many negative reviews which seem to rank unusually high.  Their central complaint is that the game is too easy with little or no need to strategize.  Either these space cadets are playing on casual (most have 4 or fewer achievements) or they are messing with Flakka and what was left of their minds is now gone.

Just by watching the trailers you will know if this is a game you will like.  There are no surprises - what you see is what you get.  The challenge and sole purpose of these games are to get 100% achievements and to beat the developers' scores.

If you liked either of the previous games you will like this but note that the difficulty level of Expert" has been ramped up a bit."

reviewText:
This game boils down to clicking lots of things as fast as possible. There's little need to strategize, just click anything that's green. Once in a while you'll click your power ups, but that's about it. It sits in a space between a pure clicker game and a casual time management game and unfortunately ends up doing neither in a way that satisfied me. Here's the thing though... certain people really seem to like it and there's a demo, so check it out for yourself or watch my playthrough. I also have a breakdown of pros and cons below the video.

https://youtu.be/4ywThSTeYtA

From the perspective of a clicker game:
+ It's more than just click this one thing"... it's has an interesting (perhaps even novel) mechanic (watch a couple minutes of the video to see it in action)
+ The price is right. It's a mobile port for sure
date:
but at least it has a mobile price.
- In a pure clicker the fun is in optimizing to get maximum clickage... there's no optimization that resonated with me. Any optimization in what I clicked felt wholly unimportant.
- No purchasable upgrades... it's nice to get something for the grind other than three stars.

From the perspective of a time management game:
+ no pros
- No need for strategy
hoursPlayed: or optimization... it's just too shallow to even qualify as a proper time management game

reviewText:
For once it's Hercules managed to get in trouble and captured twice, you need another hero... his dear and tender Megara! Roles are reversed! So instead of having a Hercules that does nothing, here's come Megara... that isn't more active than him. But she's more useful than him: she can grow plants that will give you food.

Indeed, as for the previous games, you sent your servants for resources gathering (gold, food, wood) in order to build or to expand houses, workshops, farms or gold mines that are periodically giving you... resources. But beware of the thieves that will take them if you're not fast enough! As usual, you have bonuses for stopping time, making the servants (or resources) work/walk faster, making more resources, etc... Nothing really changed from the previous games. Even Cerberus, Medusa or Pegasus are still present. There is however a new character, Charon, that can bring resources that are floating for one piece of gold.

So without real innovation, how come this game isn't boring? Because there is a challenge of beating high scores, because you want to see how the story finishes. That's the main reasons, for me at least. Indeed, the casual difficulty removes the timer and the Olympic time, so you have all the time in the world to finish the level. The normal difficulty has the timer while the higher difficulty has less time (and more points). Besides, you can unlock bonus levels by finding pieces of puzzles and reconstitue them.

Graphics are like the previous game, very colorful and nice for a casual game. The soundtrack is still the same.

If you liked the two previous games, you'll like this one. You'll like also the fact that Hercules is the one to be saved now and that thanks to Megara, you'll have food quite early in the game that will appear periodically. The challenge is still present, so, yeah, you can go ahead, the price isn't too high, you have trading cards, achievements...

reviewText:
Short version: 76%The third game in the 12 Labours of Hercules series still doesn’t bother telling a story, and sadly it also forgot to try and improve game play. It’s a good time management game, but doesn’t live up to the predecessors.

Long version:12 Labours of Hercules III: Girl Power is slowly falling into a common problem with time management series: it is running out of ideas.

The core mechanics are naturally untouched: you command a few servants who gather three types of resources used to clear the large amount of obstacles in your way. The mythological helpers return, but their role is much more limited; each stage is almost purely servant management.
This wouldn’t be that bad if the level layout would provide adequate challenge, but they are a little too gimmicky and uninspired. Game play is also slowed down by limiting the available servants on most levels to 2-3, which puts the difficulty somewhere between the first two games. Except for the bonus stages. Those are time management hell incarnate.

The series was never really big on story, and that didn't change: this time Hercules gets kidnapped and his wife Megara is on the rescue. This means no more Herc-only obstacles; they are replaced by food bushes only Megara can activate, further reducing the variety in level mechanics.

Girl Power is still a fun game, but it is showing that the series is getting tired at this point and needs new ideas.

reviewText: A fun little time-management game, just like the others in the series.  Very casual, and you probably won't get more than a  couple hours of gameplay out of it, so I'd recommend picking it up on sale.  Still, those will be an amusing and diverting couple of hours.\n\nRelative to it's predecessors: Girl Power goes back to the awful narration of the first game, instead of the amusing limericks of the second.  That was clearly a step in the wrong direction.  Also, it got rid of the boss fights; I'm still trying to figure out of that was a good move or not.  On the other hand, they levels were well done, and they continue to streamline the gameplay.  Also, the puzzle pieces were less annoying to find than in Hercules II.

reviewText:
JetDogs Studios has found its perfect cash cow with the 12 Labours of Hercules series, and they are determined to milk it. And since the series has created its own standard for time management games, who can blame them?

The third instalment is yet another simple but very polished example of the exact same recipe. And it's a good recipe, well worth the asking price for fans of the genre. The mechanics are solid, if unchanged, and the many and varied levels are decently designed. Plus, it's technically impeccable in its simplicity and understands its core audience. With a clean UI, clean and bright graphics, decent music and sound effects, a non-offensive overarching narrative that doesn't take itself seriously and is totally skippable, simple puzzle mini-games that aren't trying to be more than a breather in-between levels, lots of achievements, 3 difficulty levels and tons of content to keep you occupied for hours, it still ranks amongst the best time management games of this type out there.

Unfortunately, as good as it may be, the recipe is starting to get a bit stale. Girl Power simply has nothing new to say; if you have played the first two games, this is one of the same, just a little less interesting, less well balanced and less inspired.

Yes, the levels are well enough designed. They just aren't as clever, fun and innovative as in the first two games.  I also didn't much like how the difficulty was scaled this time around. Ignoring the aptly named relaxed mode, I finished the game in casual mode feeling mildly disappointed at the lack of challenge. Then I started again in expert mode, which ramps up the challenge by a lot and is initially very exciting. However, the excitement ended about half way through, when I realised that too often getting a gold star wasn't going to be the fun process of coming up with a valid strategy, but repetition after repetition in order to learn it by heart. So none of the modes felt as satisfying to me as I had hoped.

Again, this is a solid casual time management game, that offers many hours of play with no technical or UI hassle and at a good price. It's just not as great as fans of the series were expecting.

reviewText:
A set of four equally nice, neatly made (in every aspect) time managers. Slightly diversified (with new game play features, bonuses and surprises) to make each game a bit different, while keeping enough in common with the previouse one(s), which shortens waste of time and nerve on mastering the next game, that's valuable. Repetative, yet it feels all right here, can't remember myself being driven into bore even once. I beat all four games 100% on expert difficulty and still wouldn't mind to see the fifth. Taken into account the fact that games like these are not my idea of fun (or they weren't at least))) - what better recommendation could i give to a game. If you are looking for a highly involving and entertaining, not all that hard yet challenging enough game - check this one. Probably you will be pleased even beyond your expectations.
---------------
Серия из четырех одинаково отличных и очень качественно(во всех отношениях) сделанных игр- тайм менеджеров. Слегка отличающихся друг от друга (по набору игровых аспектов, бонусов и сюрпризов), ровно настолько чтобы не быть совсем однообразными, и при этом не вынуждать учиться играть заново, что несколько сокращает затраты времени и нервов на освоение каждой следующей игры, что порадовало. В принципе они достаточно однообразны, но здесь это не кажется недостатком, не помню ни разу чтобы это как то обломало интерес к игре.  Полностью прошел все четыре на экспертной сложности и не отказался бы от пятой. С учетом того, что сами игры далеко не из списка моих предпочтений (по крайней мере не были))), вряд ли я придумаю способ высказаться об игре в еще более позитивном духе.
В общем, если вы подыскиваете что-нибудь достаточно увлекательно-развлекательное, при этом не слишком сложное, но тем не менее бросающее определенный вызов вашим способностям в пределах разумных затрат времени и сил - то это как раз то что надо. Вполне возможно порадует даже сверх ожиданий.

reviewText: So this is the third 12 Labours of Hercules game... Still the same basis, a real-time casual game made of several levels with specific goals (collect x gold, kill the minotaurs, release the prisoner, repair the ship or the bridge, etc.). If you enjoyed the series so far, you'll probably have fun with this new opus as well, considering that the only thing that really changed, is that you now have a new character - Hercules' wife, Megara. Of course she wouldn't be throwing giant rocks around, so her ability is to grow apples. Gardening ; makes sense. You'll be disappointed, she doesn't make sandwiches - sorry. Despite the nice gameplay and music, the lack of improvements and new stuff was a disappointment. Mostly recommended with a discount coupon or if you really want some extra levels.

reviewText:
Product received for free

12 Labours of Hercules III: Girl Power it's the third installment from the series. This time, Hercules managed to get into trouble and got captured by an evil enemy. He needs to be rescued, but by who do you ask? Of course by his dear and sweet wife, Megara! So the roles got reversed. Instead of Hercule, you have the chance to play with his blonde wife, which has a habit for gardening. She can grow plants that will give you food for the period of the game. As you can see, the gameplay has been changed a little bit while the concept is still the same as the first games of the series. A simple and fun time management game in which you have to gather resources to help you build farms, workshops or gold mines. That later on, it will provide you with enough resources to reach the goal of the level. Like in the second game, you have to be fast because the thieves may happen to take them before you do.
PS: Megara isn't as strong as her husband, so there will be no more boulders in the game to move.
PS2: Servants have to do all the job while Megara stays and watch, she has the same habit as her husband, they really complete each other.

The third installment from the series has yet come again with some new features for the fans of the series. Like a new character named Charon that can bring you resources for one piece of gold. New maps to keep you company for the entire duration of the game and 44 more levels to play through and have fun. The most important segment introduced into the game is the new main character that joined us in battle to rescue Hercules, Medara. But they have also removed some things like boss battles and mini-games which may be a bit sad for the veterans of the series. But the difficulty was also scaled a lot, which will prove to be a more challenge than the last game for the achievement hunters, as they have to think fast, click rapidly and to not offer their souls to the god of rage quitting.


Pros- Support for Achievements, Trading Cards and Steam Cloud.
- Won't get boring easily since pretty much every level has to offer something else.
- Touchscreen support, a wonderful opportunity for the Windows 8 and 10 users.
- Same gameplay mechanics as the previous games, which is a relief for many fans.
- Say bye bye to the boss battles, but while the developers removed those, the hardest difficulty it's a lot more difficult than the one from the previous games.
- Colorful graphics, which shall be a very nice friend to your eyes.
- Hidden puzzle pieces around each mission for collectors to find, which later on will let you play a bonus level.
- Plenty of achievements to keep you determined in completing the game.

Cons- The minigames got removed.
- Same music as the first games of the series.
- A short story that won't find it's place in your heart.

ConclusionWhile the game may look exactly like the first games of the series, it still ranks amongst the best time management games of this type out there. So if you're a fan of the series, then go ahead and buy it as you will find in it the same excitement and fun you've found in the previous titles. For the newcomers, I advice you to start with the first game because that's where everyone else started. And it won't be nice to start from part three, would it?
I definitely recommend this game for the casual players that need something nice and relaxing in their life. And even the achievement hunters can benefit on the back of this game that will provide a nice challange for them to test their skills.

This review is a part of Steamified's Community Reviews program and the credit goes to both Steamified and Gentleman Squid Studio for providing the key for review purposes.For similar Steamified Reviews and Giveaways, please visit http://www.steamified.com/. You're also welcome to join in the fun in our Steamified group.

reviewText:
12 Labours of Hercules: Girl Power is the third installment of its' series developed by JetDogs Studios and Zoomout Games. Previous installments as follows: 12 Labours of Hercules, 12 Labours of Hercules - Cretan Bull.

Note: There is a storyline for the game but it isn't much to it nor its' rememberable. Gameplay formula is pretty much the same as the previous ones.

This is a time management game, where careful planning is required, limited amount of resources that are available throughout the game; henced the word management.

This game has the total of four episodes with 11 levels each; totaling out 44 levels altogether. There twenty-two different achievements but each of them come with a requirement. There are also puzzle pieces to find throughout the game. The four bonus levels that can be unlock when the jigsaw puzzle is completed. Plus, there is a 'super bonus' level that can be unlock after completing the final bonus level.

There are three modes, relaxed; casual and expert, the difference between them is the timer speed and scoring. In relaxed mode, no timer and no scoring. In casual mode, the timer drain a slowly and the scoring is moderately low. In expert mode, the timer drain much quicker and the scoring is much higher.

The stars that are earned from completing the level depends upon on how much time is left on the timer. This only applies to the causal and expert modes

Three Gold star is when the time has not gone pass the arrow. Two Silver star is when the time has gone pass the arrow. One Bronze star is when the timer is completely empty.

Replaying any of the levels will improve the game score and the amount star.

There are few special bonuses: Freeze Time, Worker Movement/Work Speed, Additional Worker and Increases Resources. All of these special bonuses has a certain time limit but they can be used again once the bar fills-up. These special bonuses are very useful when the game is being played on expert mode.

I don't think that this game much of replay value to it. If you're into time management games then you might find this game somewhat enjoyable to certain extent.

reviewText: A Lovely, relaxing Game!!!

I became a fan of the series since I played the first game. As its previous ones, it's addicting and fun, and the new character Mergara brings new features to manage the resources and of course, girl power.

The 12 Labours of Hercules series are enjoyable when you want to play something calm. Girl Power brings a new character to the mix, who brings along new possible strategies to finish levels. Give this a try if you liked the other parts.

reviewText:
I got this game for like 20 cents, so I can't exactly say that I made a bad investment, thus I'll give it a thumbs up as a title I purchased on discount.

If you like clicking the right things (buildings/resources) in the right sequence endlessly, you will probably have fun playing 12 LoH III. If you are in for some casual fun, though, you will get bored quickly, as the game is simply too repetitive and easy - you can finish every level in 4-5 minutes.

Meanwhile, if you want to reach" the expert objectives on all levels and find the hidden puzzle piece
date: you will oftentimes find yourself clicking in frustration and hoping that you will meet the objectives just in time. Not exactly what I look for in a game
recommended: but oh well...\n\nI've played quite a few games of this type and I am yet to finish a single one of them. 12 LoH III is abolutely identical to other games in the genre
voteText: if you like clicking stuff repeatedly in a colorful and ancient Greek setting

reviewText:
In fondo trovate la versione italiana della recensione.

My thumbs down doesn't mean this is a bad game; It still remains a good filler for dead times.
On balance, however, this chapter is a copy-paste of the previous; nothing has changed and was not introduced anything new.
Actually levels are less and more generally the game is shorter (my playing time does not count: I left it running for cards).
Also I found the story dull, although it is not a title that is played for the plot.

TL;DR:

Cons:

- Less levels
- No change introduced
- Shortly addictive
- Photocopy Levels

---

Il mio NO non deriva dal fatto che sia un pessimo gioco; rimane pur sempre un buon filler per i tempi morti.

A conti fatti, però, questo capitolo è un copia-incolla del precendente; non è cambiato niente e non è stata introdotta nessuna novità.
Anzi, in totale i livelli sono di meno ed è generalmente più corto (il mio tempo di gioco non fa testo: l'ho lasciato acceso per prendere le carte).
Ho trovato scialba anche la storiella di fondo, per quanto non sia un titolo che viene giocato per la trama.

TL;DR:

Contro:

- Meno livelli
- Nessuna novità introdotta
- Poco coinvolgente
- Livelli fotocopia

reviewText:
A very good example of the casual  time-management (CTM) game genre.

If you've played the other two games in the series this one will hold little in the way of surprises for you.  Really the only difference is that you are playing as Hercules' wife, Megara, in her efforts to save her husband and their dog (of the three headed variety) from a grabby tentacle sea monster.  If you are looking for a game that faithfully inserts the player into the plot of a classic Greek myth you might want to seek elsewhere.

If you're not hung up on  classical literacy accuracy or the ability to play as a male protagonist, and you like low stress play experience that CTM's game typically provide, this game won't disappoint.  The levels typically take 3 to 5 minutes to complete, at least at the lower levels that I played.  The pace is quick, with very little downtime waiting for resources to  mature to the point that you can harvest them.  The goals are clear, so you don't spend time wondering what the heck you're supposed to be working towards.  You can spend some brainpower trying to find the best way to manage your resources to get the told time or to beat the top of the scoreboard, but with an untimed relaxed mode there is no need to do this if you don't feel like it.  I do like that you can change the difficulty at any time,  from untimed, normal play, and hard, then back again if you feel like it.   The storyline is coherent and engaging as long as you accept that it is based on Greek Mythology in the way the Disney's Haunted Mansion ride is based on the study of spiritualism.    The graphics are bright and cartoonly peppy as befitting a game of this sort.  And the music is easily mutable, which is how I play all my games, so perhaps I am not the best reviewer to talk about that aspect.

This doesn't have the depth of Skyrim or the viseral thrill ride quality of Farcry 4, but it really doesn't have to.  It's a cute, fun little timewaster, much like my kitty who try to help" me tie my shoelaces.

8/10 For games of this type
date: not all computer games ever made."

reviewText:
I have just finished 12 Labours of Hercules III in gold time and got most of the achievements. It is a really beautfiul game, set in a nice, fantasy universe of the Greek Mythology where you play with Megara, Hercules, Medusa, The Pegasus, Nemean Lion and other legendary beings.

The aim of the game is to meet certain objectives such as gathering a set amount of resources or getting to a specific object or objects on the map. To reach these goals, the player has to gather resources which are spread across the map or produce them in some of the little 'workshops'. The resources are put on the map in a road like way so that to get to some farther away resources you need to clear the previous ones. The game is part of a genre of resource gathering and road clearing where we also have Roads of Rome and many other similar games. Also, I finished the game without encountering any sort of bugs.

I really enjoyed this game. It has a very pleasant, positive atmoshpere and message and it is very relaxing and charming, something which is very rare now in video games. The level design is nice, I really like the nice objects, colours, terrain, buildings, strategy of the game, the music which is perfectly suited to theme, story and I think everything about it. A great game, I recommend it to everyone. For 1 euro, I got 6 hours of wonderful entertainment and after finishing it, I have a very good feeling. Thank you developers. This is the third Hercules game I played, hope to see a lot more in the future! :D

Bottom line: Decent game but short. Do as I did and buy it for under a dollar. Worth at least twice that much though.

The good:
* It's Time Management with a unique queueing system (ie you can queue unavailable items) that actually makes for interesting gameplay.
* The graphics, sound, gameplay etc. are all good.
* The visual and audio feedback work a treat allowing you to know where to spend your attention (and where not to).
* The addition of puzzle pieces is a nice touch. You can even find them before starting the level so you don't have to waste time searching during gameplay.

The bad:
* It's short. I played thru it twice and it still felt like it wasn't worth full retail price.
* It's a little too easy. I got gold on most levels on my first try.
* The effects and tooltips can get in the way of seeing what you're actually supposed to do.
* The cutscenes" are pretty awful. Badly written and presented poetry sound off above non-animated paper dolls.
* The story itself is a bit confusing too. Perhaps you need to have played to previous games but I doubt it.
* I didn't bother getting the last 3 achievements as I never get anywhere near the developers scores. Maybe you have to click a whole lot of birds. Either way

reviewText: After reading some negative reviews, I must write a review and give thumbs up, I bought it on sale for 14 cents but even for its full price (three euro) it wouldn't be bad decision. People who give thumbs down probably don't know what is this game for. Maybe it's not for everyone but this game is perfect for one thing - everybody knows these boring late afternoons when you need to do something, f.e. a presentation for your work or essay on medieval British literature or whatever... but you can't concentrate, you need to turn off your brain for let's say 15 minutes or just to relax and get some new ideas. And in such situations this game is a blessing - regular game would be suicide, because you would end up playing the whole evening and doing nothing else and then you would be stressed out. This game is fun for those 15 minutes (not even a minute more) and than you can go back to your work and play it in the next boring afternoon again. You can play it on anything, it loads fast, no waiting, brilliant! and it has trading cards, which is definitely pro.
It's is a easy game , that you no need to  think about ,just do what can do , it could be good to spend you time ~~

I really like this series and the third one does not disappoint! While it maintains the same basic elements a few things have changed. First off, most of the achievements are the same but they did switch up a few to include getting gold times in the bonus levels and then in the super bonus" level. The second game first introduced these levels that were unlocked by finding the puzzle pieces on each map. This third installment rewards you for completing the bonus levels by giving you a fifth extra level after completion of the four bonus levels. I feel like this made the game sufficently long. The second thing
date: is they took away your typical "boss fights" and instead of having that little bit of reprieve by a slight change of game play
recommended: you play the boss levels just like the regular ones. I feel like this made it drag a bit since there is no reprieve from the typical game play. That being said
hoursPlayed:
it was still an enjoyable game. I also like the addition of the new character Magara. You use her to grow the berry bushed used as a food source. This extra element was really nice and add some nice touches.

Pros:
-Keeps the standard RTS elements
-New and more challenging levels
-Proactive story
votesHelpful:
and style
-New elements to add some refresh to the series
-Somewhat simple achievements
-Appropriate length of gameplay

Cons:
-Lack of typical boss fights (adds some drag to the game)

Mehs:
-Developer scores are better making them more difficult to beat
-Thieves seem more aggressive

Overall: 9.5/10"

reviewText: TOP GAMES

Buy all 3. It won't disappoint. Each sequel gets better but at the same time each game stands on its own with their solid and addicting gameplay. You can even play all 3 games simultaneously and not be overwhelmed or bored. Pick them up and keep them in your library. Definitely worth the time, money and space.

The concept of the game isnt new but it's still a decent time management type game that you can waste some time playing. I get alot of hours out of games like these since I want to complete all levels perfetly but if you are not like that you will probably fly through the game relativly fast.

very easy game, but addicting if you like getting gold stars :v\none thing that would make the game better is if my laptop had a touchscreen.

Another fun sequel in the 12 Labours series. It doesn't get boring, because in every sequel some new elements are added. If you don't like the first game, don't try this one. If you did like the first game, go wild and play them all.
This game is exactly as stupid as it sounds.
0,14 € WORTH IT! :D

This is not a good variation of the series, in my opinion. It\'s a little slower, and the choice of mechanics makes the general gameplay feel less enjoyable. Would not reccomend as highly as the two precursor games, but it\'s still not terrible if you\'re looking for speedy puzzle solving
Fast paced, draws you in.
